title: GFDhd
author: GFDhd
content: ASIC chip: BM1397AG, a total of 65;Level conversion chip: SN74LVC1T45DBVR, marked CT1*, a total of 2;Microcontroller: PIC16F1704, 1 piece, located in U3;EEPROM: AT24C02D, 1 piece, located in U5;N-ch MOS chip: TPHR9003NL, a total of 4;Boost conversion chip: MP1517DR, 1, located in U6;3-terminal regulator: AP431SAN1TR-G1, 1 piece, marked GCC, located in U4;1.8V regulator: MP2019, 1 piece, located in U28;1.8V regulator: SY8120I, marked qG***, a total of 12;0.8V regulator: SGM2036-ADJ, marked SQ7**, a total of 26;Temperature sensor chip: NCT218, marked T2*, a total of 4.The above is the information of the chip of the S17+ hash board. If there are any deficiencies, please add them.

comments.author: GFDhd
comments.created_time: August 03, 2022, 03:44:34 AMLast edit: August 05, 2022, 06:03:39 AM by GFDhd
comments.body: Or take a pic of U7 chip so I can be sure of correctness.

comments.author: ucomputernan
comments.body: I'll throw in the link to the picture here below:https://support.bitmain.com/hc/en-us/community/posts/900002830883-S17-hashboard-chip-U7

comments.author: GFDhd
comments.created_time: August 05, 2022, 06:16:27 AMLast edit: August 06, 2022, 01:00:13 AM by GFDhd
comments.body: I'm sorry for the previous reply. As I don't have a hash board on hand, my previous reply may be wrong. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5381636.0I saw in this thread that U7 is marked HMBWA, then I think the name of the U7 chip is SY7302ABC, marked HM***.

comments.author: GFDhd
comments.body: SY7208 can also be used for replacement.
